text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, I want to share with
you what I'm calling my key lime pie popsicles.

They taste like a key lime pie, very similar
to my no-bake key lime pie that I did here

years ago, but I really wanted to share this
recipe with you because key lime pie is one

of Joe's favorite desserts and he loves any
kind of ice cream or popsicles, so the two
- it's like a match made in food heaven.

Couldn't be easier to do, you need just a
handful of ingredients, but I promise they

are all the right ones. And when these are
together, they're like the taste and delightfulness

of a key lime pie in popsicle form. Couldn't
be easier!

The ingredients you'll need is heavy cream
and whole milk that I've mixed together, some

fresh lime zest and lime juice, and some sweetened
condensed milk, which you guys know, if you've

been with me for a while, sweetened condensed
milk and I have a love affair that foes way,
way back! ha!

So, it really is easy and simple, everything
goes in a blender. I've got a mixture of heavy

cream and whole milk and it really is important
that you use whole milk and heavy cream, no

light, no 2%, no fat-free, you need the real
stuff because this is really rich and creamy
and that's what makes it so, so good!

I'm going to add in my fresh lime zest and
juice.

You also want to make sure you use very fresh
lime juice, nothing out of a bottle for this.

And the gloriousness that is sweetened condensed
milk!

I mean, I could eat this stuff out of this
- just with a spoon out of the can - and quite

often have. But, this is going to be the thing
that just thickens this and it gives it the

richness and the sweetness that I love - and
this is also how I make my no-bake key lime
pie. I also add some sweetened condensed milk.
Try and get it all out of here with my spatula.

Leave the rest behind for me, and now I'm
just going to put a lid on, pop this on and
get everything well mixed!
Perfect!
I mean.. Come on!

I've got my popsicle mold here, and now what
I'm going to do - look at the consistency
of this!
I know! I know!

I know what you're thinking, that looks creamy
and delightful, and trust me when I tell you
they are.
Excellent.

I've got a little left which I will freeze
in a different popsicle mold. And now just

stick my little topper in, make sure you secure
it.

My popsicles were in the freezer overnight,
and I'm going to take one out - and I've got

some warm water here, now it's actually hot
tap water in my large cup, or a large glass,

I'm going to dunk that in - whoa!I put too
much water.

I feel like I'm living on the edge, are you
seeing this?
Dun dun dun! Da da da da!

I'm just thinking whether that was a theme
song or something from somewhere, but I don't
think so! Ha!

Look at that, look at all the little zest
of the lime running through, that just makes

me happy, you seeing it? That just makes me
happy!

Now, if you say to me 'Laura - in a Salvatore
voice, in my dad's voice - I need some crunch

because my key lime pie, I make it with a
graham cracker crust and I need some crunch'.

This is what I say to you. Get yourself some
crushed graham crackers, okay, and sprinkle

on and then as you eat this, you get little
bites of crushed graham crackers.
I know! I know!
It's actually fantastic.
It is good!

I really like the graham cracker part, so
every time I eat some of it, I go back and

cover it again with some graham crackers.
It tastes like a key lime pie, but in popsicle
form!

If you don't want to put these in popsicle
molds, or you're saying to me 'Laura, I don't

have time for popsicle molds' put these into
containers, pop them in the freezer and then
just scoop them out with an ice cream scoop!
The world is really your pickle, my friend!
Mmm..
I don't know what to say. It is perfection.
It's sweet, it's tangy, it's fresh, it's amazing!

Go to LauraintheKitchen.com to get this recipe,
recreate these, tag me on social media, I

would love to see your recreation, and let
me know down below what your favorite popsicle

flavor is, I'm really torn between this one
and Nutella.
Both really, really good.

I hope you have enjoyed spending time with
me, I'll see you next time!
Bye!
Hold on!
That thing sounds like it's mad at me!
Mmm.. okay, we ready babe?
